description: Unique identifier for the customization record.
Application module or business object this customization targets, such as work management, inventory, or purchasing.
Variant or scope within the entity—such as asset class, site, or context—used to apply the customization to a subset; confirm with SME.
Free-text description of the customization’s purpose or scope.
User account that created the customization record.
Date and time the customization was created.
User account that last modified the customization.
Date and time of the most recent modification.
Serialized configuration payload (e.g., JSON or XML) defining fields, rules, or UI behavior for this customization.
Flag indicating this is the default configuration for the entity or variant (1=true, 0=false).
Legacy display name used by an older interface or integration labeled MS14; purpose may be system-specific; confirm with SME.
Definition of UI field groupings for the customized entity, likely a serialized layout controlling section organization and visibility; confirm with SME.
